newsitem.title: UK: PRESS DIGEST - London-based Arab newspapers - July 21.
newsitem.headline: PRESS DIGEST - London-based Arab newspapers - July 21.

text.p: These are some of the leading stories in two London-based Arabic-language newspapers on Monday. Reuters has not verified these stories and does not vouch for their accuracy.
- The Palestinian Authority affirmed the arrest of officers accused by Israel of planning an attack on a settlement.
- Egypt's exports in the first quarter of 1997 were worth 3.3 billion pounds.
- United Arab Emirates' foreign trade deficit in 1996 decreased to 17.7 billion dirhams from 19.6 billion dirhams in 1995.
- Freed Algerian Islamic leader Madani says Algeria is in a state of war and that his goal is to rescue the country.
- Saudi Crown Prince Abdullah met Italy's president before the Italian leader concluded his visit to Saudi Arabia.
- Egypt and Yemen are to sign a free trade zone deal next week.
